text.script: def test_str(expect, ans): print expect, ans ans = ans.strip("'") ans = ans.strip('"') ans = float(ans) expect = float(expect) if abs(ans-expect) < 5: return True else: return False def hint_fn(answer_ids, student_answers, new_cmap, old_cmap): aid = answer_ids[0] ans = str(student_answers[aid]) print 'hint_fn called, ans=', ans hint = '' if float(ans) < 51: hint = 'Much too low.' newgrade = 0.2 elif float(ans) <= 509: hint = 'Too low.' newgrade = 0.5 elif float(ans) > 5140: hint = 'Much too high.' newgrade = 0.2 elif float(ans) >= 519: hint = 'Too high.' newgrade = 0.5 else: hint = 'Exact answer: 514 miles.' newgrade = 1 if hint: hint = "<font color='blue'>Hint: {0}</font>".format(hint) new_cmap.set_hint_and_mode(aid,hint,'always') new_cmap.set_property(aid,'npoints',newgrade)
text.p: Imagine a scaled-down universe. If the sun is at one end of a football field and Neptune is at the other, how many miles away will the nearest star be?
